sen.j: 鈴彦姫（すずひこひめ）は、鳥山石燕の『画図百器徒然袋』にある日本の妖怪。
sen.e: Suzuhikohime is a Japanese specter portrayed in "Hyakki Tsurezure Bukuro" (One hundred bags in idlenss) by Sekien TORIYAMA.

A Suzuhiko-hime (literally, Princess Bells) is one of Japanese yokai (ghosts, spirits and monsters) that was portrayed in Sekien TORIYAMA's yokai art collection book: "Gazu Hyakki Tsurezure Bukuro" (The Illustrated Bag of One Hundred Random Demons; the term 'hyakki' in its title is a pun on the usual hyakki, replacing the character for demon which is written as "鬼" in Japanese with a character for vessel written as "器," and sure enough, most of the yokais shown in this book are tsukumogami [a type of Japanese spirits that originate in items or artifacts that have reached their 100th birthday and become alive]).
sen.cmt: 原文に「画図」補足のうえ再訳出しました。

sen.j: 付喪神の一種で、頭部に鈴を頂いた女性の姿として描かれている。
sen.e: It is a kind of the Tsukumo-gami (gods to a variety of things) and portrayed as a female figure who has bells on the head.
It is a kind of the tsukumogami and portrayed as a female figure who has bells on the head.
sen.cmt: 前項との整合性で表現調整
sen.e: It is a kind of the tsukumogami and portrayed as a female figure who has bells on the head.

sen.j: 『画図百器徒然袋』中の解説文では、かつての日本で鈴が神霊を下ろすための祭具として用いられていたことが述べられている。
sen.e: According to the expository writing in "Hyakki Tsurezure Bukuro", bells were once used as ritualistic implements to call a divine spirit in Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。

sen.j: また、日本神話で天岩戸に隠れた際に天照大神を引き出したアメノウズメのことが述べられている。
sen.e: It also mentioned Amenouzume who succeeded to pull out Amaterasu Omikami (Sun Goddess) when she hid in Ama no iwato (Cave of heaven) in Japanese Mythology.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: It also refers to Amenouzume who succeeded to lure Amaterasu Omikami (the Sun Goddess) out of the Ama no iwato (Cave of heaven) in Japanese Mythology.

sen.j: 鈴彦姫は神霊を下ろす鈴が化けた妖怪、または前述の2つの共通するテーマである「神を引き出す」をもとに創作された妖怪と推測されている。
sen.e: It is conjectured that Suzuhikohime is a specter transformed from bells that called a divine spirit or a specter created based on the mutual theme of two topics mentioned above, "calling deities."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Suzuhikohime is a yokai which may have been transmuted from the bells to call a divine spirit, or she was supposedly created based on the theme of "summoning the deities" common to the above two examples.
